-   **Rarity note:** Small herbaceous wildflower found in Longleaf Pine sandhills and dry, sandy soils in the Southeastern United States.

## Natural history notes

Showy Milkwort (Asemeia grandiflora) is characterized by their single stem from a taproot, alternate, linear leaves, and pink flowers. The flowers are loosely spaced in narrow, terminal raceme.They can reach a height between 8-20 inches.
